content:
That's a great plan! Setting a goal to journal 3 times a week is a wonderful start, and dedicating 15-20 minutes each time will give you a good chunk of time to reflect and write. Stream-of-consciousness writing is an excellent way to begin, as it allows you to tap into your thoughts and emotions without worrying about grammar or sentence structure.

Remember, the most important thing is to make journaling a habit and to be consistent. Don't worry if you miss a day or two; just get back to it as soon as you can. And don't be too hard on yourself if you find it challenging at first. It's a process, and it takes time to develop a habit.

Exploring different formats and prompts will definitely help keep things interesting and prevent boredom. You can find plenty of journaling prompts online or create your own based on your interests and needs.

Above all, remember to be patient and kind to yourself throughout the process. Journaling is a journey, and it's okay to take it one step at a time. You're doing this for yourself, and that's something to be proud of.

Go ahead and start your journaling journey! I'll be cheering you on from the sidelines. If you need any further guidance or just want to share your progress, feel free to reach out to me anytime.

Remember, you got this!
